record.title: FAIR TREATMENT FOR EXPERIENCED PILOTS ACT
record.narrative:
FAIR TREATMENT FOR EXPERIENCED PILOTS ACT -- (Senate - December 12, 2007)

[Page: S15373]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H.R. 4343 which was received from the House.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 4343) to amend title 49, United States Code, to modify age standards for pilots engaged in commercial aviation operations.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read the third time and passed, the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table with no intervening action or debate, and that any statements relating to the bill be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (H.R. 4343) was ordered to a third reading, was read the third time, and passed.
